article.headline: Portland State 69, Portland 53
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Juma Kamara scored 17 points to lead Portland State to a 69-53 win over the University of Portland on Monday night. Scott Morrison added 15 points and four blocked shots for the Vikings (4-2), who won their third straight game. Deonte Huff chipped in 10 points for PSU. Walter Thompson led Portland (2-5) with 16 points and 12 rebounds. Jamie Jones added 13 points and 11 rebounds for the Pilots. Portland State led 31-27 at halftime and opened the second half with an 8-2 run to take a 39-29 lead with 16:59 left to play. A 3-pointer by Sean Smith at 13:58 gave the Vikings a 44-33 advantage, and another 3-pointer by Huff at the 10-minute mark put PSU up 51-35. The Pilots would not close within 11 points the rest of the game. Portland State shot 43 percent from the field and held Portland to just 35 percent from the floor.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
